medical_history.chief_complaint: Neonates with tricuspid valve masses causing severe obstruction and pulmonary hypertension.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Patient 1 presented with evidence of profound cyanosis the day after birth requiring intubation and initiation of treatment to maintain ductal patency. Patient 2 also required ventilation for cyanosis shortly after birth due to severe tricuspid valve obstruction. Both patients faced worsening respiratory distress leading to emergency interventions.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Mother's history of recurrent spontaneous abortions.
medical_history.family_history: Both siblings diagnosed with tricuspid valve masses, suggesting a familial recurrence.
